page.title: 17Queen Elizabeth Park
page.content: the park covers 1400 acres of woodland and downland, half of which is in this unit. The park centre, downland of Butser Hill and Iron Age farm are in the adjacent west block. The park employs 11 permanent staff and has additional help in the summer. Also students studying County Park Management. The park aims, by means of exhibitions and demonstrations to introduce country life to the public. About 500000 visit it each year. Picnic and barbecue sites are provided, some with road access for the disabled, and a variety of marked trails. These include a tree trail for identifying trees, a wayfaring trail for orienteering, butterfly, star and school trails. An escellent woodland craft area shows things made from wood and old and new forestry methods, including besom and hurdle making.
